alert.note: Alert for DeKalb; Fulton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 05 at 3:14PM EDT until April 05 at 11:43PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... North Fork Peachtree Creek near Atlanta affecting DeKalb and Fulton Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...North Fork Peachtree Creek near Atlanta. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Flood stage is reached. Minor flooding of the natural flood plain begins upstream and downstream from the gage on Buford Highway or Georgia Highway 13. This includes low portions of the backyards of residential homes on Victory Drive... Dunwoody Place and Converse Drive. This height combined with the flow on South Fork Peachtree Creek may also produce flooding further downstream on Peachtree Creek in Fulton County. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:47 PM EDT Tuesday the stage was 12.4 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 13.5 feet late this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this afternoon. - Flood stage is 13 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
